article.headline: UNLV 64, Nicholls St. 42
article.story: LAS VEGAS (AP) -- UNLV's Wink Adams had 13 points Saturday night and Matt Shaw added 12 as the Rebels held Nicholls State to 11 first half points in an easy 64-42 victory at the Duel in the Desert. UNLV (10-3) scored the game's first 10 points and never trailed as the Rebels cruised to their fourth straight victory and seventh in eight games. UNLV led 19-3 with 12:13 to play in the first half after a 3-pointer from Adams and five straight points from Shaw. Corey Bailey added 11 points for UNLV, while Troy Cage had a game-high eight rebounds in just nine minutes. The Rebels play Minnesota Sunday in the final game of the four-team, round robin event. Both teams are 2-0 in the tournament. It's the final non-conference game of the season for UNLV, which begins its Mountain West season at Colorado State on Jan. 5. Anatoly Bose led all scorers with 17 points for Nicholls State, and Adonis Gray added 10. The Colonels (4-10) shot just 30 percent, including 3-of-23 from behind the 3-point arc.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
